Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2016 02:02PM - edited Oct 30, 2016 03:12PM by pokie88 Hi. I am new today in posting but been reading. 44 yrs old premenopausal- 4 kids-married 28 years I am wondering if anyone has an opinion on my question on but feel need share last year of mammo/us and a new thing: ok- felt peanut like knot under arm had first screening mammo called back for US said benign dead lymph node under right arm, best to leave it alone and repeat mammo 4-5 months so did that 4 more times over past 1.5 years- mammo called back US said ok swelling in stomach with itchy breast and fuller breast very tender nipples on both- made appointment gyno tuesday 18th- ordered uterine d&c & ablation monday Oct 23,2016 CAUSE UTERUS THICK? had mammo Friday afternoon 10/21 Surgery Monday 23 went fine but called next day from gyno to set up surgeon appt said need biopsy right breast density change? he's out of town so his staff made US appoint 11/1 and consult on Nov 7, 2016 to discuss biopsy I know after all these call backs and weight gain, itching on breast fullness that most likely is early BC- question is- after so many mammo and US i need him not to miss it! what can i do get accurate results?! A NEEDLE WON'T MAKE ME FEEL BETTER NOW! general surgeon- what if he insists Fine needle?????? that will leave me worried oh and prolly nothing but serious chin prickling daily for a month or so?!! annoying! anyone else by slim chance? silly maybe but ???

He is the love of my life still and USUALLY my best friend.... and after 28 years of marriage, divorce is not even a possibility, however, i do not know how to explain how very much i need him without being over dramatic since we are having surgery but for biopsy not yet confirmed BC... i welcome any and all input to both issues as well as one more question- am i supposed to know "shadowing from tumor in upper outer quadrant involving 2 maybe 3 nodes" is bad from looking at it?or did i miss something?

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2016 07:49AM pokie88 wrote: Thanks Mustlovepoodles and Hopeful for the responses.. He has told me that the comment was intended to indicate he loves me so much that he would much rather lose just my breasts than me..he and I have been together for 30 years( started dating at 14 n he was 18 we married when i was 15 and he was 19 and in the military) married 28 yrs now and have 3 grown married kids (5 grands with a boy gran on the way) and a 10 yr old daughter still at home ( great surprise there yes!). he has always been the kind of person that treats me equally strong which in MOST cases i appreciate- we own a business and work together as well... very little time apart that we enjoy for the most part lol. He had a serious heart attack in 2014 and i was there in icu with him like glue and as strong as robotic mode will take one in a scare like that. (He is now 48 and I am 44 fyi) he has aggressive diabetes so I worry about his sugar and heart a lot. He has lost weight the last 2 months and i am begging him to go to the dr ( more than his pcp) and he does the same thing about his own health- if he don't hear it or see it, it's not there! kills me but i love him for him good and bad parts. we will continue to talk through these things as I do need him NOW! next question for ya though or anyone who reads this and relates- what sent me to the dr was getting very and i mean very swollen abdomen like from a flat stomach to looking 6-7 months pregnant over a week time with ab cramps low, gyn said it was from thick uterus and she insisted surgery to do d&c for biopsy with ablation (burn up my uterus) which "could be related to breast cancer so I am also ordering a mammogram". i told her then about my pcp having sent me for screening mammo in early 2015 which radiologist then asked for US of right breast, followed by report to watch "suspicious area" every 4-5 months. now if you are still reading this BOOK lol, i know NOW that I should have after the 2nd or definitely the 3rd mammo followed by US asked for another opinion, and my hubby has related frustration that he did say that last year..anyway- I had the uterus surgery 2 weeks ago almost and no biopsy back that i know of since the day after surgery 2 days after mammo- she called asking what surgeon i wanted for breast biopsy- then surgeon staff sent me for this last US in which radiologist tech told me about the "funky mess" with the nodes enlarged etc as stated above and she meant well as she was saying this to emphasize not to let it go longer if this surgeon doesn't take this serious.. so finally the question- i didn't lose weight, i am still very bloated- and i feel ill, like so weak and tired with upper back and neck bones hurting, can not eat much at a time..and this is so not like me when i have things to do and i haven't even been to the office but 3 times in a month! my pcp says he don't know what to say except wait for my surgeon to instruct us which i see him Monday- and no i can't just see someone else as my insurance is dropping me dec 31 already and we need $2500 this week in addition to what we paid out already that's not covered. we don't have it without me working full time too. so i am stuck here for now unless i get a biopsy back that is definitive enough to warrant a pre approval for my insurance to send me somewhere to a bigger city/facility.. question being did anyone feel ill as most posts say they felt great when diagnosed?
